posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.69 beta soon.

If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Using Obtanium? Remember to opt-in for pre-release tags to receive beta updates.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

  • New calling UI.

  • Open sticker management in a bottom sheet on large screen devices.

  • Add better UX when group limit reached when joining via link.

  • Ensure that attachments received during calls are auto-downloaded afterwards.

  • Fix persistent “group members have the same name” banner.

  • Fix group members alphabetical sort order.

  • Fix talkback saying meters instead of minutes.

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Pin a message to top of chat
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.68 release
Pin a message to top of chat

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.69.0 (163400)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

117 new commits since 7.68.5:

Show commits

  • Add PIN creation/entry to regV5. [1]

  • Simplify and improve the JumpToDateValidator. [2]

  • Fix transparent banner line. [3]

  • Only animate on banner creation. [4]

  • Fix PictureInPicture fling behavior and simplify focused mode. [5]

  • Add nicer dropshadow to self-pip. [6]

  • Fix call link info display. [7]

  • Fix long press crash on long polls. [8]

  • Refactor regV5 navigation to remove some unnecessary layers. [9]

  • CallGrid animation updates. [10]

  • Fix undersized additional action icon. [11]

  • Add a network debugging interface for regV5. [12]

  • Don't prevent multi-line when in 'enter is send' mode. [13]

    Fixes #14469

  • Fix call string format template. [14]

  • Fix unreliable allow multiple votes toggle. [15]

  • Fix audio indicator when system piping call. [16]

  • Add more debug info for oversized messages. [17]

  • Ensure envelope model updates info from metadata. [18]

    In practice this doesn't really matter because we don't read from it
    after this point, but good to be consistent.

  • Fix backup restore service concurrent modification crash on timeout. [19]

  • Have allowedToRequestCode take precendent in 429 reg responses. [20]

  • Support pinned messages in backups. [21]

  • Clear profile override if none exists. [22]

  • Fix export issue around long-text and quote-long texts. [23]

  • Fix some places where data_hash_end was not being set. [24]

  • Ensure when we start the calling activity that we turn the screen on. [25]

  • Backfill plaintext hashes for quotes. [26]

  • Update something else title. [27]

  • Fix notification profile overrides. [28]

  • Implement new call layout. [29]

  • Add nicer snackbar propagation. [30]

  • Fix issue where attachment albums do not update if one object is deleted. [31]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.61.0 [32]

  • Fix request to join approved message not showing up. [33]

  • Fix talkback saying meters instead of minutes. [34]

  • Avoid italicizing glyphs. [35]

  • Make megaphones scrollable again. [36]

  • Add better ux when group limit reached when joining via link. [37]

  • Fix possible crash when splitting contacts with invalid e164s. [38]

  • Fix added to group not showing up on canceled request groups. [39]

  • Allow saving e164-only contacts to your contacts. [40]

  • Dismiss media editor if you have no valid items. [41]

  • Fix request to join state mismatch with server bug. [42]

  • Potentially fix e164 crash. [43]

  • Delay auto-updates while in a VoIP call. [44]

  • Fix universal sealed sender setting in export. [45]

  • Display proper text when not in the active call on the local device. [46]

  • Abort re-reg with pin flow if unable to communicate via svr websocket. [47]

  • Update the versioning scheme for nightlies. [48]

  • Update Signal logo/branding for donation receipts. [49]

  • Update local backup v2 support. [50]

  • Remove verbose call link parsing logs. [51]

  • Remove now-unnecessary nightly auto-update stuff. [52]

  • Unconditionally disable auto updates. [53]

  • Ensure proxy settings are applied to default okhttp client. [54]

    Fixes #13682

  • Always format e164 as LTR. [55]

  • Streamline invalid qr code dialog in link device flow. [56]

  • Repair bad group storageId state on the fly. [57]

    Fixes #14308

  • Schedule search index optimization to occur overnight. [58]

  • Fix sync message author when pinning. [59]

  • Allow pinning in note to self. [60]

  • Fix crash related to timer updates. [61]

  • Add debug logging for failed media name requirements. [62]

  • Add extra info tooltips to Spinner. [63]

  • Restart the app to apply the new language setting. [64]

  • Remove unneccessary member warning during forwarding. [65]

  • Delete all messages in edit chain. [66]

  • Ensure that attachments received during calls are autodownloaded afterwards. [67]

    The easiest way to do this is to add the constraint to the job itself,
    when appropriate, so that we don't even run the job until you're done
    with the call.

  • Clean up AndroidManifest.xml [68]

  • Use updated country picker when deleting account. [69]

  • Disable image pasting when editing. [70]

  • Properly handle 413s when uploading to archive. [71]

    Fixes #14502

  • Move values from constants.gradle into libs.versions.toml [72]

  • Fix outdated comment. [73]

  • Re-organize gradle modules. [74]

  • Move the pushTranslations script into the codebase as kotlin. [75]

  • Move the pullTranslations script into the codebase as kotlin. [76]

  • Make pushing and pulling translations part of updateStaticFilesAndQa. [77]

  • Add tests for SmartlingClient. [78]

  • Fix ordering issues in updateStaticFilesAndQa. [79]

  • Enable the gradle configuration cache. [80]

  • Potential fix for Android 7 crash on chat open. [81]

    Fixes #14447

  • Fix some string capitalizations. [82]

    Fixes #14210

  • Fix self-pip mirroring. [83]

  • Display large screen participant on connecting call. [84]

  • Fix snackbar durations. [85]

  • Fix persistent "group members have the same name" banner. [86]

    The hash calculation for name collisions iterated over a Set with undefined
    order, causing inconsistent hashes and resetting the dismissed state.

  • Fix crash when rotating device in emoji reaction picker. [87]

    Adds null check for selectedConversationModel in hideInternal() to
    prevent NPE when hide() is called after the overlay has already been
    hidden during configuration changes.
    Fixes #14491

  • Allow country code selection input to be multi-line. [88]

    Fixes #14407
    Resolves #14408

  • Allow 1:1 polls and raise character limit. [89]

  • Prevent multiple instances of main-activity from being added to our task stack. [90]

  • Fix issue where latest chat would reappear after reopening the app. [91]

  • Fix message timer for chat updates. [92]

  • Fix validation error around session switchover events. [93]

  • Fix polls in local backups. [94]

  • Fix validation errors around group chat updates. [95]

  • Use legacy packaging for website builds to reduce download size. [96]

  • Fix alphabetical group members bug. [97]

  • Improve the qa task. [98]

  • Potential fix for empty BodyRange errors during export. [99]

    The only way I could see this being a problem is if the mention ACI was
    empty. We'll have to see if that fixes it.

  • Fix potential issue with reaction export. [100]

  • Update to libsignal v0.86.10 [101]

  • Rotate receive pinned messages flag. [102]

  • Calculate drag handle bounds using the container width instead of the screen width. [103]

  • Respect 429 in SVR write requests. [104]

  • Reintroduce blur behind pip. [105]

  • Hide unpinning behind feature flag. [106]

  • Open sticker management in a bottom sheet on large screen devices. [107]

  • Add missing call link ui. [108]

  • Enqueue another backup after uploading new media. [109]

  • Exit multi-select mode on back press in sticker management. [110]

  • Keem some additional reconciliation logs longer. [111]

  • Do not attach a resend listener unless an attachment is failed. [112]

  • Be more lenient with attachment restore conditions. [113]

  • Fix lint checks. [114]

  • Mark translation gradle tasks as incompatible with configuration cache. [115]

  • Update translations and other static files. [116]

  • Bump version to 7.69.0 [117]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.68.5…v7.69.0

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
117 commits

Welcome back! I hope everyone on the team had an enjoyable break :)

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Allow 1:1 polls and raise character limit.

committed 12:39PM - 08 Jan 26 UTC
mtang-signal
+138 -156

Have 1:1 polls been released yet? I’m not seeing the option to start a poll in a 1:1 chat in 7.69

link_counts.title: Allow 1:1 polls and raise character limit. · signalapp/Signal-Android@f7d87f3 · GitHub

posts.cooked:
I had to clear the cache and force stop the app to get the new calling UI, but I love it. The soft drop shadow under the camera preview, the buttons not stretching the video out anymore like before, etc. are all great changes. Some bugs from earlier releases have been fixed too, such as the long group description jumping up and backing out of the selecting stickers menu. It’s all great! Keep up the good work. I can’t wait for messaging pinning to be implemented!

There are now 2 minor bugs that still haven’t been fixed:

  • When selecting a message, the menu with options appears higher

  • Opening the sticker menu for a second time shows 2 stickers in a row instead of the usual 4

And a tiny design clean-up idea that I think folks liked, but still hasn’t been implemented:

  • In the Poll details the star icon appears too close to the text

posts.cooked:
Trying to start a video call in a group chat, pressing on the bell icon to change whether or not the call will ring everyone in the group or only notify them is buggy. The icon itself never changes, but pressing it does change the mode once. Pressing it a second or third time doesn’t do anything.

Logs

Video:

Looking at the shared media, media that is newer than a month ago is listed under “This month”, even though they are from December and it is January now.

Screenshot_20260109-1148051079×683 122 KB

These two images are from December 17 and 18.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.69.0/805e1e27d5977f90f97eb846faa0fe405c627a8a40b457f462fc08a25327525a

In case @dishes8 and others haven’t seen this from the previous beta thread:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.68 release Android Beta Feedback
I always like to follow-up on bugs like this, so wanted to say that I looked into it, and I believe I can see what happened. If an image failed to upload, tapping it will resend the message. We incorrectly interpreted the attachment state as being in this “resend” mode. I believe it’s fixed in 7.69. Thank you!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.68 release

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.68 release

posts.cooked:
shaded:

Trying to start a video call in a group chat, pressing on the bell icon to change whether or not the call will ring everyone in the group or only notify them is buggy. The icon itself never changes, but pressing it does change the mode once. Pressing it a second or third time doesn’t do anything.

Avitus:

Same type of sharing failure, but this time sharing an image from Google Messages.

Tracking these, thanks!

FluffyPotato:

Looking at the shared media, media that is newer than a month ago is listed under “This month”, even though they are from December and it is January now.

This is actually working as intended. The “This month” label in shared media represents the last 30 days, not the current calendar month

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
jeffrey-signal:

This is actually working as intended. The “This month” label in shared media represents the last 30 days, not the current calendar month

should probably rename it accordingly then, no?

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

The navbar background color is a different shade of grey from the panel and does not match.

Salt505:

when the call is “Ringing” it only displays a black screen. The user’s profile picture only displays once the call is picked up.

Both fixed in 7.69.1, thank you!

Salt505:

Signal crashes if I use the Android back key/gesture on the main chat list screen

Still facing this issue in 7.69.1, no rush, just making sure you’re aware!

More Call UI feedback

  • When video calling, if I switch to my rear camera my preview is mirrored. Meaning if I move my phone to the left, the preview acts as if my phone has moved to the right. I can try to record a video if needed, let me know who to DM it to!
  • When video calling, if I enlarge my preview while the bottom toolbar (speaker, camera, decline, etc) is open, then it doesn’t close and covers my preview. To me, I would assume that since my enlarged preview nearly fills the screen, the bottom toolbar would dismiss so it doesn’t overlap my preview.

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.69.1/f143e354dbca79b90aef0977c85a7955f3a4da8302b274d7a9d0ab0979d192e1

Thanks!!

Also, I LOVE the new call UI and animations

EDIT: Found more bugs (you’re so welcome )

When initially starting a voice call, the speaker icon shows the speaker as ON even though it’s off and only playing audio via the earpiece

signal-2026-01-09-19-38-14-7271024×2171 46.7 KB

In the video call preview screen, the mic indicator is visible but does not respond to any change in audio from my mic. As in, I talk and the indicator does not move. Should it be visible in the preview screen anyways?

signal-2026-01-09-19-40-04-5651024×2155 37.6 KB

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.69.1/e545f3b0de0d0d1e22884081334af521dd542f1d61e13225231464660a73275f

As a side note, while you are focusing on improving the calling experience, there are some relatively minor changes that could make a huge impact on UX (in my opinion):

  • Haptic feedback when toggling buttons, including (and most importantly) when accepting or declining a call. Especially for certain actions that take time to visually complete (like switching between front/rear cams), Haptic feedback would immediately indicate that an action has been triggered and is in-progress and prevent confusion.
  • Update the outgoing ringing tone sound with a recording that’s clearer and less “tinny/compressed” sounding. This is a big one, as the sound quality difference between Signal’s outgoing ringing tone is SIGNIFICANT compared to the native phone app. IMO it immediately “cheapens” the experience.
